title: Amazon Just Slashed the Price of This Ultra-Quiet Air Purifier, Now at an All-Time Low
description: With rising temperatures and increasing pollution, an air purifier has become essential for maintaining good health.

title: Why Patients Are Being Forced to Switch to a 2nd-Choice Obesity Drug
description: CVS Caremark decided to stop offering Zepbound in favor of Wegovy for weight loss. It’s the latest example of limits imposed by insurance that disrupt treatments for patients.

title: How a Sheep-Herding Cardiologist Spends His Sundays
description: Dr. David Slotwiner de-stresses from a busy week at his Queens hospital by escaping to a New Jersey farm to herd sheep with his Border collies.

title: What to Know About the Hepatitis A Outbreak in L.A. County
description: A highly contagious liver infection is surging among groups who are not typically at risk. At least seven people have died.

title: Local Officials Brace for Loss of Disaster Preparedness Funding
description: The C.D.C. delivered $750 million annually to state and local health departments for emergency work. The program was eliminated in the Trump administration’s budget blueprint.

title: The $200 Billion Gamble: Bill Gates’s Plan to Wind Down His Foundation
description: In a wide-ranging interview, he explains his decision — amid the Trump administration’s assault on foreign aid — to accelerate the end of his giving.

title: What to Know About Bill Gates’s Plans to End His Foundation
description: The billionaire philanthropist says he will accelerate his giving — but then dissolve his organization in 20 years, decades earlier than he originally planned.

title: Scientists Hail This Medical Breakthrough. A Political Storm Could Cripple It.
description: Therapies involving mRNA, a key to Covid vaccines, hold great potential in treating several diseases, but some lawmakers want to ban them and the government is cutting funding.

title: 5 Questions About mRNA Vaccines, Answered
description: We asked experts about how the technology works, its safety and its potential in medicine.

title: Migrants Are Skipping Medical Care, Fearing ICE, Doctors Say
description: They are finding that people who have been assaulted, or who have serious conditions like diabetes or a high-risk pregnancy, are skipping or delaying care.

title: Kennedy Announces New Database for Research Into ‘Root Causes’ of Autism
description: The director of the National Institutes of Health previously floated — then walked back — the idea of an autism registry, alarming researchers and parents.

title: Is it true that … ginger shots boost immunity?
description: Some see the fiery root as a miracle cure for colds, but there are easier, cheaper ways to support your immune system

title: A new start after 60: I did my first pull-up at 63 – then fought to be a ninja warrior
description: Inspired by her stuntwoman daughter, Ginny MacColl decided to get pumped; before she knew it, she was taking on all comers on the reality show American Ninja Warrior

title: The kindness of strangers: I was homeless and addicted to heroin. Joanne saved my life
description: She said, ‘Come and stay at my house. I’ll look after you and we’re going to get you into rehab’

title: Want to swim but find it too much of a hassle? Me too – but here’s how I cracked it
description: What is the equivalent of a Couch to 5k or parkrun for swimmers? Do I need loads of expensive gear? And should I join a club? Here’s how I learned to love the pool

title: Dining across the divide: ‘I was expecting her to shout me down’
description: They disagreed on freedom of movement and the UK leaving the ECHR – could they bond over AI?

title: ‘I hope this helps to capture a part of Hong Kong’s history’: Tong Ho Chung Howard’s best phone picture
description: The street photographer celebrates the vibrancy of the Chinese territory’s traditional corner house

title: ‘I lost so much weight, my husband thought I was terminally ill’: why do people lie about taking Ozempic?
description: The dramatic results of weight-loss drugs often come with a side order of stigma, as though it’s ‘cheating’ not to stick to willpower, diet and exercise alone. Is that why so many are telling no one – not even their partners?

description: You’ve been married for 50 years and you’re in love, so maybe you just speak a different ‘love language’

title: Mum wasn’t thrilled with my tattoos – then I suggested she get one too | Mike Hohnen
description: To my surprise, Mum agreed without any hesitation. She chose a symbol dedicated to her late friend – and in the process, we discovered more about each other

description: Alyssia Algeri and her new girlfriend knew they shared a love of music. But everything changed when Elissa started singing Adele’s One and Only

description: Maeve and Otto’s sex life took a real dip, but revealing what they like – and writing it down – has reawakened their passion

title: Can you be friends with bees and why does the sun look yellow? The kids’ quiz
description: Five multiple-choice questions – set by children – to test your knowledge, and a chance to submit your own junior brainteasers for future quizzes

title: Avoid same-day wilt: how to order the freshest Mother’s Day flowers

description: There’s a gap between what you want to do and what you do, advice columnist Eleanor Gordon-Smith writes. Thinking about how it affects others might help

description: Questions on general knowledge and topical trivia, plus a few jokes, every Thursday. How will you fare?

description: Martha says Dad doesn’t need to know her every move. Neil says following her on an app helps him feel connected. Who’s lost the plot? You decide

title: It took five minutes of practice a day to make me a guitarist | Letter
description: Letter: Matthew Butte on how taking small steps to do something can be transformational

title: The aristocrat diet: why do posh people eat such beige, bland, boring food?
description: They like ice-cream – but only homemade. Carrots – but only served whole. And don’t even think of cooking with any herb or spice livelier than parsley ...

title: Food and freedom: exhibition charts radical history of gardening in Britain
description: Artefacts from 11th century on display at British Library in London, alongside work of modern-day community group

title: Houseplant clinic: why is my begonia growing lopsided?
description: It may need repotting after a move from the kitchen to the bathroom

title: I’m losing my mum to young-onset dementia. Caring for my baby reminds me who she was | Alexandra Hansen
description: Now that I am a mother, I think of her often. Sometimes, when I need advice, I try to imagine what hers might have been

title: Are you a people pleaser? It’s time to find out what you really want
description: It’s easy to go through life mirroring what others want and how they see you. But don’t you deserve more?

title: The one change that worked: I could never get fit – until I tried a 40-second plank every day
description: All my attempts at exercise had ended in failure, so I decided to lower the bar. Five years of planking later and I’m a stronger and healthier person – sorry ‘athlete’

title: ‘The beauty of this angle is the distortion’: Sanket Khuntale’s best phone photo
description: The Indian photographer was delighted with the image he captured during a stroll in Pritisangam Gardens with friends

title: A child on thin ice: EA Hanks on life with her abusive mother – and world-famous father
description: One half of the author’s early life was spent with a mother who struggled with addiction, her mental health and caring responsibilities. The other was with her father Tom on film sets and in a house full of love and structure. She discusses her road trip back into her complicated past
